title: FIFA U20 Women World Cup Qualifiers : Uganda takes control after first leg victory over Namibia
body_text:
Uganda U20 Women’s Football National Team, the Queen Cranes have advantage over Namibia in the FIFA U20 World Cup Qualifiers, following their win in the first leg.
In the first leg played at FUFA-Kadiba Stadium on Friday, Uganda secured a 3-0 win over Namibia to put on leg in the third and final qualifying round.
Slyvia Kabene, Barbane Anomo and Mary Kantono scored a goal each to guide Uganda to victory.
Despite dominating proceedings in the first half and creating several chances, Uganda failed to find the much needed effectiveness in front of goal and the first half ended goalless.
However, the breakthrough came two minutes after the break when Nambia’s goalkeeper Slyvia Ndiweteko fumbled Kabene’s effort and it went into the back of the net.
Eight minutes from time, defender Anomo made made a run into the box was in the right place to head home Uganda’s second goal of the day.
Substitute Kantono put the icing on the cake in the ninth minute of added time, capitalizing on a rebound to fire home.
The two teams will face off again in the return leg on Monday next week to determine who advances to the third and final qualification round.
The winner between Uganda and Namibia will face either Zambia or Burundi in the next round.
